title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Facey Medical Foundation
Interview Descriptions: I was scheduled an interview with the manager, supervisor, and a staff member. Questions were not difficult and just the usual interview questions to get to know you and how you would handle certain situations.
Interview Questions: Have would you handle conflict with a coworker?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Facey Medical Foundation
Interview Descriptions: Disorganized process to get interview. Many delays and lack of communication. The people were very nice when I finally got an interview. Very professional, but no intimidation. Great company to be with.

title: Patient Care Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Facey Medical Foundation (Burbank, CA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very smooth and the hiring manager made it sound like a conversation versus a formal interview with question after question. She explained the role, company benefits, and pay range. I was offered the position two days after the interview, unfortunately, I did not accept because pay was not great.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What kind of experience do you have and how would it help with the position you are applying for. How do you deal with stress? What is a weakness and a strength?

title: Primary Care Family Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Facey Medical Foundation in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant and friendly. Answered my question. Went over benefits for 30 mins. No formal questions . 2 interviews last f 30 mins each. W e r t t nanny’s she’s s dhshs

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Facey Medical Foundation (Mission Hills, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy and very helpful. The process was fast and everyone I cane in contact with was nothing but welcoming and cheerful   All the employees I saw during my interview seemed happy and liked there job
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years  and how do you see yourself within this company

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Facey Medical Foundation (Mission Hills, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews that took place. One with HR and one with management. It was a very easy going and comfortable interview. Mostly asked about your experience and tried to get to know you as a person.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Facey Medical Foundation (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Great easy and smooth interview. Nice supervisors in interview. Supervisors made me feel calm and answered all my questions. Interview lasted about 20 minutes and was told I will get a call from Human Resource and got a call the next day.

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Facey Medical Foundation (Mission Hill, MA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: It is very difficult to have sometime from human resources to call you,  you need to keep applying for months.  When they do finally call you,  you have to interview with HR first,  then they forward you information to the hiring manager,  and you wait for a call from them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us

title: Receptionist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Facey Medical Foundation (Mission Hills, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received a phone call within one week, attended interview and was asked what my strengths and weakness were as an employee over a 15 minute time period. Was told I would then receive a second phone call if a supervisor was interested and would continue the interview process.
Interview Questions: When ever was I asked to handle a task outside of my job description, what was it and how did I handle it?

title: Hospitalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Facey Medical Foundation in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Initial contact via facey.com and in-house recruiter for Facey Medical Group, who referred you to the Chief Hospitalist for a brief phone interview. Interview day consists of meeting with Chief Hospitalist at Providence Holy Cross Medical Center for about an hour, during which you will mainly hear about the details about the hospitalist duties first, then have a brief hospital tour. After that, you meet with 2 of the administrative physicians (the President and Chair/Associate Chair of Medicine) at the same time, who will ask some basic as well as behavioral questions in a relaxed environment. These included:
1. Tell us about yourself
2. Why hospitalist?
3. Why Facey?
4. Provide an example of when you had to give bad news?
5. Provide an example of when you showed leadership? 
6. What makes you a good fit?
7. Any questions for us? 

Then, they would talk about the organization itself for about 20-30 mins, after which they go over the benefits and compensation.
Interview Questions: Nothing too difficult (see above), but asked more questions than other hospitalist interviews that I have been on. They really want to see if you are a good fit according to their mission and values.

title: Business Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Facey Medical Foundation (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Process is excellent.  Met with the hiring managers and got a reply for hire that day.
Interview Questions: Their position doesn’t pay as much as what you’ve earned before.

title: Psychotherapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Facey Medical Foundation (Mission Hills, CA)
Interview Descriptions: My situation was unique as I was a prior coworker of our medical director.  the HR process is rather protracted unfortunately.  The interview process is standard.  As a licensed provider verification, insurance contracting, etc added time to the process.

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Facey Medical Foundation (Mission Hills, CA) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: Turned in the application, had initial interview the next day. Person I met with asked about my past experience but I got the feeling this was mainly a fact-checking exercise. Met later in the week with the department manager for a much more thorough interview. She was very friendly and asked several "what-if" questions. Then camethe background check, drug test, etc. The processing part of the hiring seemed really extensive.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about compromise when it comes to teaching people and getting their buy-in?
